title: Norwegian flies closer to safety with £1.2bn Chinese plane deal
text:
Low cost airline Norwegian has moved one step closer to survival by offloading a slew of planes to a Chinese bank – a deal that will save the cash-strapped airline $1.5bn (£1.2bn).

Twenty-seven Airbus aircraft owned by Norwegian will be transferred to a joint venture owned by China Construction Bank Corporation.

The move is the latest in a string of cost-cutting measures implemented by interim chief Geir Karlsen.

It comes as the world’s fifth-largest low-cost airline announced a record quarter of trading. Pre-tax profit rose by more than a third to 2.2bn Norwegian krone (£187m) - this despite a 3pc fall in the number of passengers numbers.

Norwegian has been touted as for some time been touted...
